name: Mass-Spring-Damper / Series RLC (Force-Voltage, Maxwell analogy)

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism (identical transfer function under mapping)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: identical bond graph topology with effort=force/voltage, flow=velocity/current
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: identical Dirac structure; H_mech(x,v) maps to H_elec(q,i)
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism between Mech and Elec functors

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: isomorphism breaks for nonlinear spring/capacitor; degree measurable
degradation_analysis.stochastic: additive noise preserves structure; multiplicative noise breaks it

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation at DEVS Level 3
notes: Most thoroughly studied cross-domain isomorphism in engineering

name: Mass-Spring-Damper / Parallel RLC (Force-Current, Firestone analogy)

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism (identical transfer function under dual mapping)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: identical bond graph topology with effort/flow roles swapped relative to I-1
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: identical Dirac structure under dual mapping; H_mech(x,v) maps to H_elec(lambda,v)
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism between Mech and Elec_dual functors

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: isomorphism breaks for nonlinear spring/inductor; degree measurable
degradation_analysis.stochastic: additive noise preserves structure; multiplicative noise breaks it

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation at DEVS Level 3
notes: Dual of I-1; maps mass to capacitor, spring to inductor (inverse). Preferred by bond graph community.

name: Mechanical Translational / Mechanical Rotational

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism (identical ODE form under variable substitution)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: identical bond graph topology; effort=force/torque, flow=velocity/angular velocity
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: identical Dirac structure; H_trans(x,v) maps to H_rot(theta,omega)
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism between Trans and Rot functors

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: isomorphism breaks for nonlinear springs/inertias; degree measurable
degradation_analysis.stochastic: additive noise preserves structure; multiplicative noise breaks it

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation at DEVS Level 3
notes: Direct structural isomorphism; identical mathematical form

name: Electrical (RLC) / Hydraulic

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism for laminar flow (linear resistance)
mathematical_characterizations.probabilistic: homomorphism (degree depends on noise model and flow regime)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: identical bond graph topology with effort=voltage/pressure, flow=current/flow rate
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: identical Dirac structure; H_elec(q,i) maps to H_hyd(V_fluid,Q)
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism between Elec and Hyd functors for linear regime

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear (laminar) systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: turbulent flow (R proportional to Q) breaks exact isomorphism; degrades to homomorphism
degradation_analysis.stochastic: flow turbulence introduces multiplicative noise; structure partially breaks

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation at DEVS Level 3
notes: Valid for laminar flow (linear resistance). Turbulent flow introduces nonlinearity (R proportional to Q), degrading to homomorphism.

name: Electrical / Thermal

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism for first-order RC/thermal dynamics only
mathematical_characterizations.discrete_moore: homomorphism for first-order; no mapping for second-order
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: partial bond graph mapping; no thermal flow source analog to voltage source in general
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: partial Dirac structure; only dissipative and capacitive ports map
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: faithful functor from Thermal to Elec_RC (not full; no inductance image)

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; first-order isomorphism preserved at each step
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for first-order dynamics
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves first-order isomorphism exactly
degradation_analysis.stochastic: thermal fluctuations follow different statistics than Johnson noise

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation limited to first-order at DEVS Level 3
notes: PARTIAL isomorphism: no thermal analog of inductance (no thermal inertance). Only first-order dynamics are isomorphic. Second-order thermal behavior requires different physics.

name: Electrical / Acoustic

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism (identical transfer function under mapping)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: identical bond graph topology with effort=voltage/pressure, flow=current/volume velocity
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: identical Dirac structure; H_elec(q,i) maps to H_acoustic(xi,U)
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism between Elec and Acoustic functors

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: high-SPL nonlinearities break isomorphism; degree measurable via THD
degradation_analysis.stochastic: acoustic noise preserves structure for small perturbations

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) representation at DEVS Level 3
notes: Well-established in acoustics and loudspeaker design. Thiele-Small parameters used in audio engineering.

name: Mechanical Translational / Mechanical Rotational (via lever/gear coupling)

domain_a.name: Mechanical (translational with lever arm)
domain_a.governing_equation_continuous: M*x'' + B*x' + K*x = F(t), with coupling: F = tau/r, v = omega*r
domain_a.governing_equation_transfer: H(s) = 1/(M*s^2 + B*s + K) with transformer ratio r

domain_b.name: Mechanical (rotational with gear train)
domain_b.governing_equation_continuous: J*theta'' + B_r*theta' + K_r*theta = tau(t), with coupling: tau = F*r, omega = v/r
domain_b.governing_equation_transfer: H(s) = 1/(J*s^2 + B_r*s + K_r) with gear ratio n

variable_mapping.coupling_ratio: r (lever arm length) or n (gear ratio)

mathematical_characterizations.continuous_ode: exact isomorphism via transformer element (lever/gear ratio)
mathematical_characterizations.bond_graph: bond graph with transformer (TF) element; ratio = lever arm or gear ratio
mathematical_characterizations.port_hamiltonian: Dirac structure with transformer port; preserves power: F*v = tau*omega
mathematical_characterizations.category_theory: natural isomorphism with transformer natural transformation

degradation_analysis.euler: O(dt) error; isomorphism preserved at each step but drift accumulates
degradation_analysis.rk4: O(dt^4) error; near-isomorphism for practical step sizes
degradation_analysis.exact: matrix exponential preserves isomorphism exactly for linear systems
degradation_analysis.nonlinear: gear backlash and friction introduce nonlinearity; degree measurable
degradation_analysis.stochastic: mechanical clearance introduces stochastic behavior at gear mesh

t3sd_connection: Z-model (Moore machine) with transformer element at DEVS Level 3
notes: Extends I-3 by including coupling elements (lever, gear). The coupling ratio acts as a transformer element (bond graph).

name: Electrical / Magnetic (reluctance analogy)
notes: Direct analogy used in magnetic circuit analysis. Well-established in transformer and motor design.

name: Mechanical / Fluid (compressible)
notes: Includes compressibility effects. Reduces to I-4 for incompressible flow.

name: Chemical Kinetics / Electrical (RC)
notes: Rate constants map to conductances for first-order reactions. Nonlinear kinetics (Michaelis-Menten, Hill) break exact isomorphism.

name: Population Dynamics / Electrical (nonlinear)

domain_a.name: Population dynamics (Lotka-Volterra)
domain_a.governing_equation_continuous: dx/dt = alpha*x - beta*x*y; dy/dt = delta*x*y - gamma*y

domain_b.name: Nonlinear electrical circuits
domain_b.governing_equation_continuous: Nonlinear ODE circuit with multiplier elements

notes: Isomorphic only in linearized regime around equilibrium. Full nonlinear dynamics have no exact electrical analog.

name: Control (s-domain) / Signal Processing (z-domain) via bilinear transform
notes: Tustin/bilinear transform preserves stability mapping. Exact algebraic isomorphism between s and z domains.

name: Queuing Networks / Fluid Networks
notes: Flow conservation holds in both. Stochastic arrivals in queuing break deterministic isomorphism. Mean-value analysis preserves some structure.

name: Biological Neural Networks / Electrical (Hodgkin-Huxley/RLC)
notes: Does the Hodgkin-Huxley neuron model have exact circuit isomorphism? The H-H model uses voltage-gated conductances which have been modeled with equivalent circuits.

name: Economic Supply/Demand / Hydraulic Flow
notes: Price-pressure, quantity-flow mapping. How far does the analogy extend? Equilibrium vs. dynamic behavior.

name: Thermodynamic / Information-Theoretic
notes: Landauer's principle connects information erasure to thermodynamic work. Shannon entropy vs. Boltzmann entropy. Formal isomorphism between thermodynamic and information-theoretic entropy.

name: Heat Exchangers / Electrical Transmission Lines
notes: Distributed parameter analogy. Both governed by coupled PDEs (telegraph equations vs. heat equation in 1D). PDE-level vs. ODE-level isomorphism.

name: Software Architecture / Control System Topology
notes: Feedback loops, stability, modularity as morphic properties. Can software architectural patterns (observer, MVC) be formally mapped to control system topologies?

name: Epidemic Models (SIR) / Electrical/Chemical Networks
notes: SIR compartmental dynamics as circuit analogs. Susceptible-Infected-Recovered flows mapped to current flows through resistive/capacitive networks.
